remarks.format: ## Remarks 泛型类是与 O 键/值对的数组 (日志`n`) 检索，其中 n 是字典中的元素的数目。The generic class is an array of key/value pairs with O(log `n`) retrieval, where n is the number of elements in the dictionary. 在中，它是类似于泛型类。In this, it is similar to the generic class. 两个类具有类似的对象模型，并且都具有 O (日志`n`) 检索。The two classes have similar object models, and both have O(log `n`) retrieval. 两个类的不同之处是在内存使用和的插入和删除的速度：Where the two classes differ is in memory use and speed of insertion and removal: - 使用较少的内存比。 uses less memory than . - 具有更快的插入和删除操作未排序的数据，O (日志`n`) 而不是 O (`n`) 为。 has faster insertion and removal operations for unsorted data, O(log `n`) as opposed to O(`n`) for . - 如果从已排序的数据，在一次填充列表比快。If the list is populated all at once from sorted data, is faster than . 另一个区别和类在于支持的键和值通过返回的集合的有效索引的检索和属性。Another difference between the and classes is that supports efficient indexed retrieval of keys and values through the collections returned by the and properties. 不需要时重新生成列表属性可以访问，因为列表是内部数组的键和值的只是包装器。It is not necessary to regenerate the lists when the properties are accessed, because the lists are just wrappers for the internal arrays of keys and values. 下面的代码演示如何使用执行从排序列表的字符串值的按索引检索的属性：The following code shows the use of the property for indexed retrieval of values from a sorted list of strings: 每个元素都可以作为对象。Each element can be retrieved as a object. 密钥对象必须是不可变，只要它们是否用作中的键。Key objects must be immutable as long as they are used as keys in the . 中的所有键必须是唯一的。Every key in a must be unique. 密钥不能为`null`，但值则可以为，如果在列表中，值的类型`TValue`，为引用类型。A key cannot be `null`, but a value can be, if the type of values in the list, `TValue`, is a reference type. 需要进行排序并执行比较的比较器实现。 requires a comparer implementation to sort and to perform comparisons. 默认比较器检查是否键类型`TKey`实现并使用该实现中，如果可用。The default comparer checks whether the key type `TKey` implements and uses that implementation, if available. 如果没有，检查是否键类型`TKey`实现。If not, checks whether the key type `TKey` implements . 如果键类型`TKey`不实现任何接口，可以指定中接受的构造函数重载的实现`comparer`参数。If the key type `TKey` does not implement either interface, you can specify a implementation in a constructor overload that accepts a `comparer` parameter. 容量是元素的数目可以保存。The capacity of a is the number of elements the can hold. 如元素添加到，自动增加容量通过重新分配在内部数组所需的方式。As elements are added to a , the capacity is automatically increased as required by reallocating the internal array. 可以通过调用减少容量或通过设置属性显式。The capacity can be decreased by calling or by setting the property explicitly. 减少容量重新分配内存并将复制中的所有元素。Decreasing the capacity reallocates memory and copies all the elements in the . 对于非常大对象，你可以通过设置增加到 20 亿元素在 64 位系统上的最大容量`enabled`到的配置元素的属性`true`在运行时环境中。For very large objects, you can increase the maximum capacity to 2 billion elements on a 64-bit system by setting the `enabled` attribute of the configuration element to `true` in the run-time environment. `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 返回集合中的元素的类型的对象。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) returns an object of the type of the elements in the collection. 由于的元素是键/值对，元素类型不是键的类型或值的类型。Since the elements of the are key/value pairs, the element type is not the type of the key or the type of the value. 相反，元素类型是。Instead, the remarks.format: ## Remarks 中的所有键必须是唯一根据指定的比较器。Every key in a must be unique according to the specified comparer. 容量是元素的数目，调整大小之前可以容纳。The capacity of a is the number of elements that the can hold before resizing. 如元素添加到，自动增加容量通过重新分配在内部数组所需的方式。As elements are added to a , the capacity is automatically increased as required by reallocating the internal array. 如果可以估计集合的大小，指定的初始容量，则无需执行大量的大小将元素添加到时调整操作。If the size of the collection can be estimated, specifying the initial capacity eliminates the need to perform a number of resizing operations while adding elements to the . 可以通过调用减少容量或通过设置属性显式。The capacity can be decreased by calling or by setting the property explicitly. 减少容量重新分配内存并将复制中的所有元素。Decreasing the capacity reallocates memory and copies all the elements in the . 此构造函数是 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是`capacity`。This constructor is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is `capacity`. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建具有初始容量为 5，且不区分大小写的比较器的当前区域性的已排序的列表。The following code example creates a sorted list with an initial capacity of 5 and a case-insensitive comparer for the current culture. 该示例添加四个元素、 一些具有小写键和带有大写密钥。The example adds four elements, some with lower-case keys and some with upper-case keys. 然后，此示例尝试将元素添加只是大小写，不同于现有密钥的密钥捕获所产生的异常并显示一条错误消息。The example then attempts to add an element with a key that differs from an existing key only by case, catches the resulting exception, and displays an error message. 最后，此示例显示不区分大小写的排序顺序中的元素。Finally, the example displays the elements in case-insensitive sort order. remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 字典将保留在使用内部树的排序顺序。The dictionary is maintained in a sorted order using an internal tree. 每个新元素都位于正确的排序位置，并对树进行调整以维护排序顺序，只要移除元素。Every new element is positioned at the correct sort position, and the tree is adjusted to maintain the sort order whenever an element is removed. 枚举，时维护排序顺序。While enumerating, the sort order is maintained. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 之前， 返回相同的对象。 returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过的末尾的集合，枚举数定位在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置上，后续调用返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以使用下面的语法通过此属性访问集合中的特定元素：`myCollection[key]`。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[key]`. 密钥不能为`null`，但值则可以为，如果在列表中，值的类型`TValue`，为引用类型。A key cannot be `null`, but a value can be, if the type of values in the list, `TValue`, is a reference type. 如果未找到此项时正在检索一个值，引发。If the key is not found when a value is being retrieved, is thrown. 如果密钥未找到时设置一个值，添加的键和值。If the key is not found when a value is being set, the key and value are added. 你还可以使用中不存在要添加新元素的键的值设置属性; 例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the ; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果指定的键已存在于，则设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the , setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. C# 语言使用关键字进行定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 检索此属性的值是 O (日志`n`) 操作，其中 n 是。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(log `n`) operation, where n is . 将属性设置为 O (日志`n`) 操作，如果密钥已处于。Setting the property is an O(log `n`) operation if the key is already in the . 如果该键不在列表中，将属性设置为 O (`n`) 未排序的数据或 O 操作 (日志`n`) 如果在列表的末尾添加了新元素。If the key is not in the list, setting the property is an O(`n`) operation for unsorted data, or O(log `n`) if the new element is added at the end of the list. 如果插入导致大小调整，运算复杂度为 O (`n`)。If insertion causes a resize, the operation is O(`n`). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用属性 （C# 中的索引器） 来检索值，演示请求的键不存在，并且可以替换与某个键相关联的值的显示时引发。The following code example uses the property (the indexer in C#) to retrieve values, demonstrating that a is thrown when a requested key is not present, and showing that the value associated with a key can be replaced. 该示例还演示如何使用方法作为更高效的方法来检索值，如果程序必须经常尝试在已排序的列表中不。The example also shows how to use the method as a more efficient way to retrieve values if a program often must try key values that are not in the sorted list. 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供类。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 属性返回可以用于对访问进行同步的对象。The property returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the . 同步是仅当所有线程在访问该集合之前都锁定此对象有效。Synchronization is effective only if all threads lock this object before accessing the collection. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 你还可以使用属性不存在的键的值设置字典; 中添加新元素，例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the dictionary; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果在字典中已存在指定的键，则将设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the dictionary, setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 此方法为 O (`n`) 操作未排序的数据，其中`n`是。This method is an O(`n`) operation for unsorted data, where `n` is . 它是 O (日志`n`) 如果在列表的末尾添加了新元素的操作。It is an O(log `n`) operation if the new element is added at the end of the list. 如果插入导致大小调整，运算复杂度为 O (`n`)。If insertion causes a resize, the operation is O(`n`). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何访问类通过接口。The following code example shows how to access the class through the interface. 代码示例创建一个空具有字符串键和使用的字符串方法添加一些元素。The code example creates an empty of strings with string keys and uses the method to add some elements. 该示例演示方法抛出异常时尝试添加重复的键，或如果提供的密钥或错误的数据类型的值。The example demonstrates that the method throws an when attempting to add a duplicate key, or when a key or value of the wrong data type is supplied. 下面的代码示例演示如何使用多个其他成员接口。The code example demonstrates the use of several other members of the interface. remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过的末尾的集合，枚举数定位在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置上，后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何通过使用枚举已排序的列表中的键/值对`foreach`语句 (`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中， `for each` c + + 中)，从而隐藏的枚举器使用。The following code example shows how to enumerate the key/value pairs in the sorted list by using the `foreach` statement (`For Each` in Visual Basic, `for each` in C++), which hides the use of the enumerator. 具体而言，请注意，枚举数接口返回对象而非对象。In particular, note that the enumerator for the interface returns objects rather than objects. 此代码示例摘自的更大的示例，包括输出，为提供方法。The code example is part of a larger example, including output, provided for the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合在创建之后不能再添加或移除元素，但是允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合是只是一个集合的包装器防止添加和移除元素;因此，如果对基础集合，包括添加或移除元素，进行更改的固定大小的集合将反映这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在创建只读集合后，该集合不允许添加、移除或修改元素。A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created. 集合是只读的是只是一个集合与防止集合; 进行修改的包装因此，如果对基础集合进行更改，只读集合将反映这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性返回`null`如果`key`不能分配给键的类型的类型`TKey`的。This property returns `null` if `key` is of a type that is not assignable to the key type `TKey` of the . 可以使用下面的语法通过此属性访问集合中的特定元素：`myCollection[key]`。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[key]`. 你还可以使用属性不存在的键的值设置字典; 中添加新元素，例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the dictionary; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果在字典中已存在指定的键，则将设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the dictionary, setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. C# 语言使用[这](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md)关键字来定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the [this](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md) keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 检索此属性的值是 O (日志`n`) 操作，其中 n 是。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(log `n`) operation, where n is . 将属性设置为 O (日志`n`) 操作，如果密钥已处于。Setting the property is an O(log `n`) operation if the key is already in the . 如果该键不在列表中，将属性设置为 O (`n`) 未排序的数据或 O 操作 (日志`n`) 如果在列表的末尾添加了新元素。If the key is not in the list, setting the property is an O(`n`) operation for unsorted data, or O(log `n`) if the new element is added at the end of the list. 如果插入导致大小调整，运算复杂度为 O (`n`)。If insertion causes a resize, the operation is O(`n`). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用属性 （C# 中的索引器） 的与，以及方法属性不同于属性。The following code example shows how to use the property (the indexer in C#) of the interface with a , and ways the property differs from the property. 该示例演示，如属性，属性可以更改与现有密钥关联的值，用于添加新键/值对，如果指定的键不在已排序的列表。The example shows that, like the property, the property can change the value associated with an existing key and can be used to add a new key/value pair if the specified key is not in the sorted list. 该示例还显示与属性，属性不会引发异常，如果`key`未在已排序的列表中，返回空引用相反。The example also shows that unlike the property, the property does not throw an exception if `key` is not in the sorted list, returning a null reference instead. 最后，该示例演示了如何该获取属性将返回空引用，如果`key`不正确的数据类型，并在设置属性引发异常，如果`key`不正确的数据类型。Finally, the example demonstrates that getting the property returns a null reference if `key` is not the correct data type, and that setting the property throws an exception if `key` is not the correct data type. 此代码示例摘自的更大的示例，包括输出，为提供方法。The code example is part of a larger example, including output, provided for the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过的末尾的集合，枚举数定位在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置上，后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法可以用于降低集合的内存开销，如果没有新的元素将添加到集合。This method can be used to minimize a collection's memory overhead if no new elements will be added to the collection. 重新分配和复制较大的成本但是，可能很大，因此方法不执行任何操作如果列表为在多个容量的 90%。The cost of reallocating and copying a large can be considerable, however, so the method does nothing if the list is at more than 90 percent of capacity. 这样可以避免产生的相对较小有所提高大型重新分配费用。This avoids incurring a large reallocation cost for a relatively small gain. 此方法为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is . 若要重置为其初始状态，请在调用方法之前调用方法。To reset a to its initial state, call the method before calling method. 截去空的容量设置到默认的容量。Trimming an empty sets the capacity of the to the default capacity. 此外可以使用设置容量属性。The capacity can also be set using the property.
